unnormalised: PayTM's latest gaffe has netizens in splits! Turns out, their "instant cashback" offer wasn't *quite* as instant as advertised. Users trying to snag that sweet, sweet Rs. 50 off on their chai and samosa orders (total bill: ₹150, approx.) are reporting waiting times longer than a Bollywood wedding.
normalised: PayTM's latest gaffe has netizens in splits! Turns out, their "instant cashback" offer wasn't quite as instant as advertised. Users trying to snag that sweet, sweet rupee fifty off on their chai and samosa orders (total bill: rupee one hundred and fifty, approximately) are reporting waiting times longer than a Bollywood wedding.

unnormalised: Apparently, the promised "5-second cashback" is more like a "5-business day cashback," leading to hilarious memes and tweets. One user joked, "My great-grandchildren will probably receive the cashback before I finish this samosa. Still waiting for Rs. 20 I was promised!". PayTM's stock price? Currently hovering around Rs. 850. Could this be the reason?
normalised: Apparently, the promised "five-second cashback" is more like a "five-business day cashback," leading to hilarious memes and tweets. One user joked, "My great-grandchildren will probably receive the cashback before I finish this samosa. Still waiting for rupee twenty I was promised!". PayTM's stock price? Currently hovering around rupee eight hundred and fifty. Could this be the reason?

unnormalised: PayTM has issued a statement saying they're experiencing "unprecedented demand" for their services. Unprecedented, or just unexpectedly slow? We're guessing their customer support is getting hammered with angry customers demanding their ₹50 back. At this rate, they might need to offer a 'delayed cashback' cashback of, say, ₹100, just to keep the peace!
